title: Spammers Bypassing Filters
creator: Oldneweng
content:
I have an email filter set for a domain that has been sending many spam messages. It was working but now they have started to use my name portion of my email address in their email address. For example, if my email address starts with bobp@ then the email address at the top of the email is bobp@ncqkl.com. The domain is real.

The only option for the first column of the filter I am aware of that can be used is "From", "Contains" and "Email Address". I don't believe Thunderbird allows domains. I have tried ncqkl.com to no avail. Somehow they are getting around filters by using your email name portion. They were also using multiple different addresses all with the ncqkl.com domain.

Is my best bet to use the adaptive spam system? I haven't really used it in the past as I haven't needed to. I don't get much spam usually as I don't have much of a presence on the net. Just lately the amount of spam has increased considerably.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:146.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/146.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/blocking-sender"]

title: email account passwords after migration
creator: Machba
content:
I migrated my Thunderbird installation to a new computer. The installation has 25 email accounts and is now requiring passwords be entered for each account including a couple of gmail accounts.

It was my understanding passwords would be migrated when using the export/import tool within Thunderbird. Is this not so?

Do I now need to change passwords for all email accounts? (because, of course these may have been written down years ago but cannot be located at this time. :-( ) Or, is there some way of restoring the email account passwords?

      • side note: The migration was not seamless but mostly due to my own ignorance. When using the export/import tool from one Linux machine to another I found the following:

- Thunderbird versions must be the same on both computers - After export, file on USB drive was only accessible by root on new computer - export zip file needed to be copied to user account on new computer (from within root account) and ownership changed to [user]: -R (I imagine you could just change ownership on the USB but this seemed easier)
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:MX Linux (versions 21.3 and 25);kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-thunderbird-profiles", "/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data"]

title: Thunderbird 147.0 systematic issue during email download
creator: michele.scaraggi
content:
Good day,

I have installed the latest version for win64. Every time the software is downloading emails (I use POP3 for gmail), if I am concurrently doing something else with it (e.g. selecting an email with the right mouse button to delete it, or creating an event for the calendar, or just selecting something from the menu bar), the software gets stuck. I then have to kill it and restart, sometimes it takes multiple kill and restart sequences.

I am using Thunderbird from the very beginning o fit, but this issue is pretty annoying. Any advise?

Thanks and BR M

title: Verbesserungsvorschlag für das UI, als Bitte an die Entwickler
creator: zeug
content:
Hallo Profis. In Thunderbird sind die Einstellungen nicht zentral erreichbar, sondern zum Teil in verschachtelten Untermenüs zu finden. Das ist extrem unübersichtlich, verwirrend und zeitraubend bei allen Einstellungsversuchen. Mein Vorschlag lautet deshalb:

Bitte kreieren Sie ein Einstellungsmenü, in dem ALLE Einstellungsmöglichkeiten zusammen gelistet und gebündelt sind. Und zwar so: 1. Das Hauptmenü heisst "Einstellungen", der Button ist das bekannte Zahnrad. 2. Die Untermenüs heissen "Email-Einstellungen", "Kalender-Einstellungen" usw. 3. Im Untermenü "Email-Einstellungen" sind jetzt ALLE möglichen Einstellungsoptionen gelistet. Im Untermenü "Kalender-Einstellungen" sind jetzt ALLE möglichen Einstellungsoptionen gelistet.

Das wäre eine sinnvolle Verbesserung des UI für alle User. Vielen Dank im Voraus. Peter
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Thunderbird "Send Later" suggestion
creator: PeterMartinez
content:
I decided to try the Send Later feature in Thunderbird. I am using T140esr and the About box says it'sup-to-date although I do see references in the forum to later versions.

I couldn't get it to work at first, but got there in the end. I would like to suggest to the developers that the buttons labeled "SEND NOW" and "PUT IN OUTBOX" be removed. These confused me. If I had wanted to send the message now or put it in the outbox, I would not have clicked the "Send Later" button in the first place. The "Send at ...", "In 15 mins", etc. buttons should be the only ones presented to the user.

It's a useful feature and I can see myself using it on a regular basis to send daily and weekly logs as attachments.

Regards Peter M
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0

title: Thunderbird NOT working anylonger under Windows 11 with Gmail?!
creator: info2511
content: Since we needed to upgrade 2 PCs to Windows 11 (1x Pro & 1x Home) nothing works anymore with Thunderbird. It has MASSIVE and unsolvable problems to connect to our Gmail account via OAuth, Not only will it ask every single time again and over again to allow the connection, but moreover even after granting access it still can NOT send (SMTP) or save or even receive (IMAP) emails. It is maga frustrating and I am currently after days and days spend to unsuccessful fix the problem are at the point to looks for a more reliable alternative (if there is any). Just as background: Our Gmail account is about 14GB big, the local Thunderbird folder around 100GB; so yes it's big, but that's another problem, there are no easy or straightforward off-line archivers any longer to effectively and still easy accessible reduce the local archive.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:Windows 11
